question-text: Are the following qstatements True (or) False?

set1.question-item-text: The two acceleration vectors a&#x20D7<sub>c</sub> and a&#x20D7<sub>r</sub> are perpendicular to each other.
The normal force F<small><small>N</small></small> exerted by a banked road is parallel to the road.
Wind energy is the kinetic energy of air in motion.
Convection occurs only in a liquid or a gas, never in a solid.
An echo is repetition of sound due to the reflection of sound.
For a vacuum, k = 1 and for other insulating materials K > 1
A source of electromotive force has an external resistance.
A transformer is used to change the voltage of an alternating current.
The commonly used invisible light for LED is white light.
An inertial frame is a frame of reference that has no acceleration.

set2.question-item-text: The tangential acceleration is present in nonuniform circular motion.
When a skater forms a circle, he has to lean outwords.
Fossil fuels are renewable sources of energy.
Heat radiation does not require  material medium.
The intensity of an echo is less than that of the original sound.
Variable capacitor is used as tuning capacitor.
The practical unit of electrical energy is the joule.
A transformer is used to change the voltage of an alternating current.
LCDs consume much more power than LEDs and gas-plasma displays.
Gamma rays can be deflected by electric and magnetic fields.

set3.question-item-text: In the uniform circular motion, the magnitude of the velocity remains

set4.question-item-text: The centripetal force is the force acting towards the centre of curvature.
The oil used in the motor car's brake system is compressible.
Solar energy is indeed classified as a type of non-renewable energy.
Heat conduction represents a form of energy transfer.
Sound travels at different speeds depending on the medium through which it passes.
When one side of a capacitor holds a positive charge, the other side holds an equal negative charge.
Electromotive force is measured in volts.
In Myanmar, the prevalent AC line frequency is 50 Hz, while the standard voltage utilized for residential and commercial applications falls within the voltage of 220 V to 230 V.
One advantage of LEDs is their common use with low voltage and high current.
The term “radioactivity” is used to describe the rate at which a radioactive sapmle undergoes decay.
